experience.title: Driver License Senior Examiner
experience.organization: State of NC - DOT-DMV, Newton Office

info.supervisor: Sandy Horton [Western District Manager] - Phyllis Young [Charlotte District Manager]

experience.responsibilities: Exercise judgment and discretion while working independently. Listen, understand and explain and communicate effectively with all customers, parents, children, court system personnel, Raleigh DMV and any other persons who have an interest. Test customers for purposes of medical conditions to make sure they are medically and physically capable of safely operating a motor vehicle on the public highway and promote highway safety. Deal with complex situations that include such things as very sensitive medical problems and age related conditions that would prevent customers from safely driving. Also work with families in areas of conditions that would prevent customers from driving and those who do not qualify, explaining the situation and reasons in order to help them with the transition from driving to no longer having a license. Handle complex problems using the Examiner Manual, NCGS Chapter 20 and other available sources obtained from the NC Justice Academy. Handle PC computers, Viisage Digital Imaging System, multiple line telephone system, Nemo-Q, printers, scanners, etc. Evaluate authenticity of foreign and domestic documents for cases of fraud and identity theft. Process cases of fraud and identity theft to Enforcement and other law enforcement agencies and investigate for further information. As cases are prosecuted, appear in court to testify on behalf of the DMV and correctly and effectively answer questions in reference to NCGS Chapter 20 and DMV policy and procedure. Have access to confidential imaging process and retrieve images for purposes of fraud and identity theft. Constant training and keeping up to current information on use of the court system and other records available. Accountability for accuracy and completion of work in a timely period. Make sure customers understand outcome on taking care of citations, suspensions and out of state problems so they can effectively take care of these issues. Extra skills and knowledge in pulling up, using and reading court system records to determine eligibility for license. Conduct interviews to determine eligibility for license and id for customers. Making complex decisions to assist customers in proper decisions on reinstatements, testing, and corrective or preventative actions. In situations where fraud is being committed, contact law enforcement, if needed, to take appropriate action. Provide relevant documentation and exhibits for court proceedings if warranted. Handle daily money collections and balance sheets. Make sure all monies are accounted for and that all transactions recorded are accurate. Make fee adjustments where applicable for purposes of correct issuances and auditing. Collect monies, balance sheets, bank deposits and disperse funds for daily use of eight examiners @ the West Charlotte Office. Conduct medical re-exams including road testing and all medical information for eligibility and summarize doctor reports and vision statements. Work with local, state, and federal law enforcement agencies as well as courts and out of state agencies and DMV offices, stateâ€™s attorneys, courthouses, judges, Social Security Administration, and many other government and private companies to provide effective customer assistance and insure compliance with NCGS Chapter 20 and all other laws and state policy. Possess a working knowledge of NCGS Chapters 14 and 15. Be able to determine that vehicles used for road test meet and qualify for NCGS Chapter 20 requirements before testing is permitted, including commercial vehicles and motorcycles. Communicate with a diverse range of customers and individuals to provide them with accurate service, including the hearing impaired, physically impaired, those from other cultures with different languages than our own, and all types of personalities, to ensure customer service while maintaining the integrity of our Division. Provide expert listening and question abilities to gather information to assist the customer. Operate and move equipment in the DMV to provide better and more adequate service. Previous employment in the Maryland State Police consisted of Automotive Safety Inspector. Primary duties were supervising 120 inspection stations and 400+ inspectors. Testing and conducting these programs @ a facility where 30 to 50 individuals were given written testing @ one time. Four to five hour hands on testing were performed for each individual who wanted to enter into the program. CDL testing was also given for Class A B and C with multiple endorsements.
experience.notes: Also supervised the Hickory DMV Office.

experience.title: Driver License Examiner
experience.organization: State of NC - DOT-DMV, Newton Office

info.supervisor: Cathy Rudisill [Senior Examiner] - Wiley 'Danny' Thomas [District Manager]

experience.responsibilities: Extensive training in different computer programs such as: CDLIS; SADLS; Court documents system; motor vehicle system. Fraudulent document training and recognition; Knowledge of Motor Vehicle Laws; FMCSR for commercial vehicles and drivers; recognition of medical issues and administering testing for clarification. Daily contact with diverse people with various issues dealing with fraud, identity problems, dwi, court issues, dmv investigations, certification of persons for driving privileges, actual testing in all types of motor vehicles.

experience.title: Driver License Examiner
experience.organization: State of NC - DOT-DMV, Charlotte West Office
experience.responsibilities: Driver license examiner in Charlotte West office which is a cdl and mc site. Diversified ethnic group of customers with a high percentage of immigration issues. High volume customer base. Work is independent since we do not currently have a ds or a senior examiner. Daily contact with immigration, medical and many other issues. Handles the front desk and also the camera to issue tdc and id cards.

experience.title: Automotive Vehicle Safety Inspector II
experience.organization: State of Maryland, Maryland State Police

info.supervisor: Sgt. William Lasner and Capt. Jeff Gahler

experience.responsibilities: Supervise stations and Md. State Inspectors for compliance in certification and procedures in the safety inspection program. Conduct testing for applicants into the program. Cite and prosecute offenders. Maintain and operate a state car, computer, cell etc. Trained in ASE program; serve as DO @ the MVA in MD. Handle diverse problems; resolve situation with a wide diversity of ethnic backgrounds. Maintain docs for court hearings. Travel was a daily part of this position. Managed 71 inspection stations.

experience.title: Commercial Vehicle Inspector
experience.responsibilities: Primary assignment was at the scale facility in Upper Marlboro, MD. Working in teams, we also conducted stationery patrols and road side weighs. I was also assigned to the post crash team and was on call for fatality and PI accidents involving commercial vehicles. Proficient in preparing docs for court proceedings. Certified in weights & measurements, level I-V inspections, Haz mat; Bulk and Tankers and Post Crash Investigations. Certificates in Accident Causation Investigation; Post Crash Investigation with Accident Reconstruction ( Commercial Vehicles and other classes of motor vehicles). Weights and Measurements; Level I through V motor vehicle inspections; Citation and report preparation; Certificate of Completion for Automotive Safety Inspections (six month training through Catonsville Comm. College (ASE). 10/2001 through 05/2006 Salvage Vehicle Certification Training.
